What is BODMAS?

BODMAS is an acronym for Brackets, Orders, Division, Multiplication, Addition Subtraction.

Of what use is BODMAS?

In a mathematical statement or expression involving different operators such as Brackets, Division, Multiplication, Addition, Subtraction, 5+(4-3)-6*4/2+52 for instance, BODMAS enables you to remenber which of the operators should be evaluated first. So with BODMAS you can easily recall the order in which to solve mathematical problems.

In what order is mathematical problems involving different operators solved?

Brackets: calculations inside the bracket are done first.
e.g 5+ (4-3) -6*4/2+52 should simplify to 5+1-6*4/2+52
Orders: numbers involving powers or square roots or indices or exponents are evaluated next.
5+1-6*4/2+52 simplifies to 5+1-6*4/2+25
Division or Multiplication: you can do division before Multiplication or Multiplication before division, the order in which these two are done does not matter. I normally do division first. It is first on the BODMAS acronym also.
5+1-6*4/2+25 simplifies to 5+1-6*2+25
And 5+1-6*2+25 simplifies to 5+1-12+25
Addition or Subtraction: after brackets have been cleared, numbers involving powers evaluated, multiplication or division done, the next operation is addition or subtraction. As with mutltiplication and division , addition and subtraction can be done in any order. I usually do addition first.
5 +1-12+25 simplifies to 31-12 . Note that any number not preceeded by a sign such as 5 in this calculation is most likely a positive number.
And 31-12 finally simplifies to 19

Are there other acronyms similar to BODMAS?

Yes! PEMDAS and BIDMAS for instance. They all work like BODMAS
PEMDAS stands for: Parentheses-same as brackets, Exponents-same as orders, Multiplication and Division, Addition and Subtraction.
In BIDMAS I stands for indices, which is similar to orders.
